intro: Polyalthia membranacea, commonly known as the white-flowered satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
